Project Manager is, firstly, a \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Role\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" assigned to an employee, where one is ultimately responsible for the success of a company's production or internal work on the scale of a particular project(s) or project portfolio up to a governance structure for the project / program.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"As a CMMI Level 5 company, EPAM requires PM/DMs to maintain, enhance and use an organized, well-indexed, searchable repository of process assets that is easily accessible by anyone who needs process guidance on project roles and various delivery and operational process overviews, examples of data and templates for artifacts or other process support materials.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A process asset is any process guidance, in whatever form, that an organization believes is worth investing in and evolving or storing, and that the organization expects will provide a return on investment that makes it worthwhile to store and/or evolve the asset.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The repository is located in the \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://epam.sharepoint.com/sites/policy\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Ethics and Compliance Library\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" (ECL).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-quote\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"For Delivery and Project Managers, their main work process is described in the reports\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Questionnaires about customer satisfaction\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" (Customer Satisfaction Survey)\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Interviews are conducted to clarify peculiar project issues such as customer satisfaction, causes of problems, solutions, planned preventive and corrective actions, and discussed improvement proposals (IPs). Using the experience of other projects, good practices (GPs), and their own experience, auditors work together with the project team to find the optimum solution that positively affects further project activities. Cases of inconsistencies (NCs - Non-conformities) are investigated. Discrepancies are recorded in the audit report and deadlines to eliminate inconsistencies are defined. There is an AUDIT system which consists of the following
